#define PIZ_HASHTABLE_FLAG_NONE   (0L)

(DEFAULT) Don't free items.

Definition at line 66 of file pizHashTable.h.

#define PIZ_HASHTABLE_FLAG_FREE_MEMORY   (1<<0)

Free items with free().

Definition at line 67 of file pizHashTable.h.

Function Documentation

PIZHashTable* pizHashTableNew ( long  size  ) 

Create the hashtable.

The size should be a prime number, default is 157. In case of failure the pointer is NULL.

Parameters:
size The size of the hashtable.
Returns:
A pointer to the new hashtable.
Remarks:
The following shows how to create an hashtable. 
 PIZHashTable *hashtab = NULL;

 hashtab = pizHashTableNew (53);  
 hashtab = pizHashTableNew (0);   // default value.

Definition at line 78 of file pizHashTable.c.

void pizHashTableFree ( PIZHashTable *  x  ) 

Free the hashtable.

It is safe to pass NULL pointer. Item's memory is released according to flags.

Parameters:
x A Pointer.

Definition at line 83 of file pizHashTable.c.

void pizHashTableClear ( PIZHashTable *  x  ) 

Clear the hashtable.

Item's memory is released according to flags.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.

Definition at line 106 of file pizHashTable.c.

PIZError pizHashTableAdd ( PIZHashTable *  x,
long  key,
void *  ptr 
)

Add item to the hashtable.

The provided pointer can not be NULL. Key must be superior or equal to zero.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
key The key.
ptr A pointer to the item.
Returns:
An error code.
Remarks:
It is safe to add items with equal keys.

Definition at line 133 of file pizHashTable.c.

PIZError pizHashTableRemoveByKeyAndPtr ( PIZHashTable *  x,
long  key,
void *  ptr 
)

Remove an item with a given key and a given pointer.

Item's memory is released according to flags.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
key The key.
ptr A pointer to the item.
Returns:
An error code.

Definition at line 171 of file pizHashTable.c.

PIZError pizHashTablePtrByKey ( const PIZHashTable *  x,
long  key,
void **  ptr 
)

Get an item with a given key.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
key The key.
ptr The adress of a pointer to set.
Returns:
An error code.
Remarks:
In case of equal keys, older item is returned.

long  key 
)

Test if the hashtable countains an item with a given key.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
key The key.
Returns:
True if found the key, otherwise false.
